item.title: Safety in Zig: How Debug Allocator Works
item.description: Zig is not a memory-safe language. It, however, provides some tools to help avoid some memory safety issues. One of the key tools that help achieve this is the debug allocator. The debug allocator is a special memory allocator that tracks memory allocations and deallocations, helping identify memory leaks and other memory-related issues during development. Since zig isn’t a GC language and does not have a borrow checker, partly due to its design goals, the debug allocator plays a crucial role in helping avoid some memory safety issues.
